content: the starting chain of 2nd panel to the side of the 1st panel* using same yarn & hook start at begin here* fo edge insert hook to top right chain of panel 2 & to the side of the bottom double_crochet of panel r1 ch1 half_double_crochet in the same space of both panels continue crocheting the panels together* half_double_crochet ---> to last chain of panel 2 * on panel 1 place 2 half_double_crochet per row * on panel 2 place 1 half_double_crochet per chain ch1 & fo hc gnitrats first seam starting chain half_double_crochet seam second seam notice the first seam r has some dimension to it- this will be hidden as it will be the wrong side 1st of the poncho panel make sure to make the next seam on the same wrong side - so both seams can be hidden- seam 2 2nd panel *connecting the final r fo edge of panel 2 & starting chain of panel 1 insert hook to the top right double_crochet of the panel 2 the double_crochet right before fo* & the top left chain of fo edge panel 1 *start at the star s* r1 ch1 half_double_crochet in the first st of both panels continue crocheting the panels together* half_double_crochet ---> to eor half_double_crochet seam hc gnitrats neckline scallops the poncho is almost complete- for some extra detailing scallops are made across the neckline of the poncho using the same yarn & hook attach yarn to the top edge of the back panel center spot - on the right side begin here* r1 single_crochet along the edge of the neckline ⟶ 2 single_crochet per row* to eor slip_stitch to first single_crochet do not turn r2 ch1 single_crochet in the same st double_crochet in next st in the next st double_crochet ch1 double_crochet single_crochet into the next st continue repeating this four stitch pattern 1- single_crochet 2- double_crochet 3- double_crochet ch1 double_crochet 4- single_crochet repeat 1- 4 to eor slip_stitch to first single_crochet fo fringe trim lastly adding the fringe materials needled yarn scissors hook 4 5in x 4 5in piece of cardboard* the length of the cardboard piece will be about the length of the fringe strands- make yours shorter or longer depending on your liking fringe will be added along the bottom edges of the poncho placing one fringe into each of the v- stitch row double_crochet ch1 double_crochet row fringe only in these row* row with to make a fringe wrap the yarn around the cardboard 3 times- starting strand should be on the bottom cut the yarn at the bottom of the cardboard pull the yarn off - keeping it folded in half on a v_stitch row insert hook pull center of fringe strand through v_stitch row slip_stitch & tighten- repeat in every v_stitch cut here* and your ♡ gemma poncho is complete ʚ ɞ˚ weave in any loose ends & block your top for best results
